name: Risk Management System Establishment
objective: Establish a continuous, iterative AI risk management system integrated into the overall enterprise risk management framework to ensure systematic identification, assessment, treatment, and monitoring of AI-related risks throughout the AI system lifecycle in compliance with EU AI Act Article 9(1).
requirements: Define AI risk management framework document
Define risk management roles and responsibilities

name: Risk Management Lifecycle Integration
objective: Integrate risk management activities into each phase of the AI system lifecycle to ensure risks are identified, assessed, and managed at appropriate points, maintaining risk traceability from design through decommissioning.
requirements: Define risk activities for each lifecycle phase
Document risk decisions at phase gates
Block phase progression if risk gates not met
evidence: Risk Assessment Checklist per Lifecycle Phase (CHK-AI-RM-001)
Risk Assessment Records per AI System (REC-AI-RM-001)

name: Risk Register Maintenance
objective: Maintain a comprehensive AI risk register for all AI systems to enable effective risk oversight, tracking, and reporting, ensuring all identified risks are properly documented, assessed, and managed.
requirements: Populate risk register for each AI system
Review risk register quarterly with AI Governance Committee
Archive closed risks annually (retain for 10 years)
Maintain audit trail of all changes

name: Known and Foreseeable Risk Identification
frequency: Initial assessment, after substantial modifications, annually
objective: Systematically identify known and reasonably foreseeable risks related to health, safety, and fundamental rights for each AI system to ensure comprehensive risk coverage and enable appropriate risk treatment decisions.
requirements: Review similar AI systems for lessons learned
Document all identified risks in risk register
Minimum 10 risks identified per high-risk AI system
evidence: Risk Identification Report per AI System (RPT-AI-RM-002)

name: Risk Analysis and Evaluation
objective: Analyze and evaluate identified risks using a consistent risk assessment methodology to determine risk levels, prioritize risks for treatment, and enable informed risk management decisions.
requirements: Assess likelihood for each identified risk
Assess impact for each identified risk
Document risk assessment in risk register
Escalate high and critical risks to AI Governance Committee

name: Bias and Discrimination Risk Assessment
frequency: Before training, after dataset updates, annually
objective: Specifically assess risks of bias and discrimination per EU AI Act Article 10(5) to prevent discriminatory outcomes and ensure fairness across all protected characteristics.
requirements: Document bias risks in risk register
Create mitigation plan for identified bias risks

name: Risk Treatment Strategy Selection
frequency: Per identified risk, after risk assessment
objective: Select and implement appropriate risk treatment strategies for each identified risk to reduce risks to acceptable levels, ensuring critical and high risks are properly mitigated before deployment.
requirements: Review each risk in risk register
Assign treatment owner and target date
Block deployment if critical/high risks not treated

name: Risk Control Implementation
objective: Implement technical and organizational controls to mitigate identified risks, ensuring controls are designed, implemented, tested, and operational before deployment.
requirements: Design controls for all mitigated risks
Link controls to risks in Risk Register

name: Residual Risk Assessment
objective: Assess residual risk after control implementation and determine acceptability to ensure no unacceptable risks remain before deployment, protecting health, safety, and fundamental rights.
requirements: Calculate residual risk for each mitigated risk
Update risk register with residual risk scores
Block deployment if unacceptable residual risks remain

name: Continuous Risk Monitoring
objective: Implement continuous monitoring of AI risks throughout the operational lifecycle to detect risk indicator threshold breaches, identify emerging risks, and enable timely risk response.
requirements: Define risk indicators for each AI system
Set up alerting for threshold breaches
Escalate threshold breaches per escalation criteria

name: Periodic Risk Reviews
objective: Conduct periodic comprehensive risk reviews to ensure risk register remains current, controls remain effective, and emerging risks are identified and addressed.
requirements: Update risk register based on review

name: Risk Management Effectiveness Assessment
objective: Assess the effectiveness of the AI risk management system annually to identify improvement opportunities, ensure continuous improvement, and demonstrate risk management maturity.

name: Risk Reporting
objective: Report AI risks to appropriate stakeholders per defined frequency and escalation criteria to ensure timely risk awareness, enable informed decision-making, and support regulatory compliance.
evidence: Quarterly Risk Report to AI Governance Committee (RPT-AI-RM-012)

name: Stakeholder Risk Communication
objective: Communicate AI risks to relevant stakeholders including deployers, users, and affected persons to ensure transparency, enable informed use, and comply with EU AI Act transparency obligations.
